title._content: "Flagstones," Charles Clinton Marshall house, 117 East 55th Street, New York, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Flagstones," Charles Clinton Marshall house, 117 East 55th Street, New York, New York. Tea house/sleeping porch] [between 1921 and 1922] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. Landscape: Abby Story (Mrs. Charles C.) Marshall. Other: This garden was comprised of three lots at 117 and 119 West 55th Street, owned by Charles Clinton Marshall who lived at 117. At the 1922 City Gardens Club of New York City exhibition at the New York Camera Club, Abby Story Marshall won "Before and After" Special Medal for the garden she developed from the three back yards. Today: House and garden not extant. Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 173. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16138 Call Number: LC-J717-X98- 64
